isopy.dtypes.IsotopeArray¶

class isopy.dtypes.IsotopeArray(data, keys = None)[source]¶

A custom view of a structured numpy array storing data with IsotopeString keys.

Functions much like a normal structured numpy array with a few exceptions.

Parameters:
  • data (list) – test 1
  • data – test 2
  • keys (list of str) – A list of keys to be used with the data supplied.

Examples

Init examples

keys()¶

Return an IsotopeList containing the array keys.

Returns:List containing the IsotopeString keys stored in the array.
Return type:IsotopeList

Examples

>>> a = IsotopeArray(5, keys = ['pd105', '106Pd', '108pd'])
>>> type(a.keys())
IsotopeList
>>> a.keys()
['105Pd', '106Pd', 108Pd']
filter(isotope=None, **filter)[source]¶

Return new IsotopeArray with isotopes of current array that passes matches the supplied filter parameters.

See IsotopeList.filter() for description of available filter parameters.

Returns:New array containing only the isotope keys that match the specified filter parameters.
Return type:IsotopeArray
